means: 用魔术变出( conjure的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: The entertainer didn't fool us with his conjuring.
sentence.Network_cn: 那个艺人变的戏法没有骗到我们.

sentence.Network_en: Every day a different chef will be conjuring up delicious dishes in the restaurant.
sentence.Network_cn: 每天，饭店里会有一位不同的大厨像变戏法似的奉上可口的菜肴。

...作中最突出和给人留下最深刻印象的部分，以确保能够“唤起”(conjure up)人们对原作的回忆。

entry.def: If you conjure something out of nothing, you make it appear as if by magic.

example.ex: Thirteen years ago she found herself having to conjure a career from thin air...
example.tran: 13年前，她认识到自己得白手起家创造出一番事业来。

example.ex: They managed to conjure a victory.
example.tran: 他们出人意料地取得了胜利。

entry.tran: 重要人物(或组织)的名字;有影响力的名字
entry.def: If you say that the name of a particular person or organization is a name to conjure with, you mean that that person or organization is very important and influential in the field you are discussing.

example.ex: By 1920, Fox and Universal were already names to conjure with.
example.tran: 到1920年，福克斯和环球已经声名显赫。

means.word_mean: 1. calling up a spirit or devil

auth_sentence.content: A Letter from the Queen, conjuring him to return without delay.
auth_sentence.res_content: A Letter from the Queen, conjuring him to return without delay.

auth_sentence.content: This is real summer listening, conjuring up warmer climes than here.
auth_sentence.res_content: This is real summer listening, conjuring up warmer climes than here.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This is real summer listening, conjuring up warmer climes than here.

auth_sentence.content: Yet this conjuring trick produced only a single dimension of highly warped space.
auth_sentence.res_content: Yet this conjuring trick produced only a single dimension of highly warped space.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Yet this conjuring trick produced only a single dimension of highly warped space.
